input_text:
Job Title: Radiation Therapist

Location: Washington, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Customer Service, Training

Description:
Radiation Therapist required for Clinical Application Specialist position

**This position is a field role and requires up to 90-100% business travel to different hospitals in Northern California and Seattle /Washington**
About VisionRT
Vision RT is a fast-growing MedTech company revolutionizing radiation therapy. We are the inventors of Surface Guided Radiation Therapy (SGRT), a technology that uses 3D cameras to make radiation therapy safer, more accurate and more comfortable for patients. Our systems are used in all 15 of US News & World Reports’ top 15 “Best Hospitals for Cancer.”As part of the Danish company William Demant Holding, one of the largest healthcare companies in the world.

About the role:
The Clinical Applications Specialist will provide training and support for Vision RT’s customers as required by Vision RT’s Business Plan and in accordance with Vision RT’s Quality Management System.



Key Responsibilities will includeLiaising closely with key customer sites to develop clinical protocolsAttending exhibitions and providing product demonstrations/assisting sales at customer sitesProviding clinical applications training to customers both on site and remotely, as well as creating and implementing support training information (workflows, user guides, e-learning courses)Providing phone support to customers and colleagues on the clinical operation of Vision RT systemsCoordinating or leading customer and/or employee training classes. May also conduct group presentations at seminars, training programs and trade showsLiaising with R&D to provide product feedback and recommendations for improvement, and providing testing and feedback analysis to development staffAssisting in generating customer information bulletins (CIB) and tracking and delivery of those bulletins

Essential Skills & ExperienceAssociate degree or equivalent (bachelor's degree preferred)3+ years minimum experience in Clinical radiotherapy environmentAlignRT/OSMS experienceProficient in Microsoft Office productsExcellent communications skillsExcellent customer service skillsExperienced working in a fast paced commercial or clinical environmentMust have a valid driver's license and passport is required as 90-100% of this role involves travel both domestic and international
 Desirable Skills & ExperienceA strong team-playerSelf-motivated and result orientated
We are an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

Conducting group presentations at seminars, training programs, and trade shows
Liaising with R&D to provide product feedback and recommendations for improvement
Assisting in generating customer information bulletins (CIB) and tracking and delivery of those bulletins
